p: Type II keratin was the third protein found to be upregulated by more than two-fold in the injured pulp ( Figure 3, red arrows: 742, 757, and 1189). Keratin is the most common contaminant in many mass spec labs because it is present everywhere, on our hands and hair. Hodge et al. [ 27] reported that keratin could also be introduced from unexpected sources because type II keratin is present in all mammalian epithelial cells.
